p: The nsp3 segment, delineated as highly variable in the above comparison between the human SARS-CoV-2 and its closest animal homologs, is also the most divergent upon alignment of the human SARS-CoV-2 with the previous SARS-CoV-1 (responsible of the 2002 epidemics) [ 12], and even more dissimilar in the MERS-CoV (agent of the Middle East respiratory syndrome) [ 13] ( Figure 2). In particular, multiple deletions and insertions make it unlikely that these homologous regions could adopt identical folds and perform similar functions.
